notes.right: partial date of birth may be provided minimum of year of birth

description.left: Donor's last known state of living or deceased

notes.left: Cause of death is only required to be submitted if the donor's vital_status is 'Deceased'.
notes.right: Cause of death is only required to be submitted if the donor's vital_status is Deceased.

description.left: Indicate the donor's height, in centimeters (cm)
description.right: Indicates the donor's height, in centimeters (cm).

description.right: Indicates the donor's Body Mass Index (BMI) in kg/m².

description.right: Indicates the donor's availability of genealogical data

description.right: Indicates if the donor is a proband or a family member

description.right: Unique identifier for the Study.

description.right: Unique identifier of the donor, assigned by the data provider.

description.left: Unique identifier of the biospecimen, assigned by the data provider
description.right: Unique identifier of the biospecimen, assigned by the data provider.

description.left: Description of specimen tumor/normal status for data processing
description.right: Description of specimen tumor/normal status for data processing.

description.left: Indicate the ICD-O-3 topography code for the anatomic location of a biospecimen when it was collected
description.right: Indicate the ICD-O-3 topography code for the anatomic location of a biospecimen when it was collected.

description.left: The code to represent the histology (morphology) of neoplasms that is usually obtained from a pathology report, according to the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (WHO ICD-O-3)
description.right: The code to represent the histology (morphology) of neoplasms that is usually obtained from a pathology report, according to the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (WHO ICD-O-3). Refer to the ICD-O-3 manual for guidelines at https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/42344.

notes.left: If biospecimen is a tumor, Refer to the ICD-O-3 manual for guidelines at https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/42344

description.left: Unique identifier for the Study
description.right: Unique identifier for the Study.

description.left: Unique identifier of the donor, assigned by the data provider
description.right: Unique identifier of the donor, assigned by the data provider.

description.left: Unique identifier of the diagnosis event, assigned by the data provider
description.right: Unique identifier of the diagnosis event, assigned by the data provider.

description.left: Disease category as defined in the WHO ICD-10
description.right: Disease caregory as defined in the ICD-10

notes.left: This refers to the body systems chapters of the WHO ICD-10, https://apps.who.int/classifications/apps/icd/ClassificationDownload/DLArea/Download.aspx
notes.right: This refers to the body systems chapters of the WHO ICD-10

description.left: ICD-10 code and term used to define a condtion
description.right: Name of diagnosis

examples.left: C41.1: Malignant neoplasms of mandible, C16.9: Malignant neoplasm of stomach, unspecified

notes.left: Write code and full term used in ICD-10 separated by a (:). For WHO ICD-10 codes, refer to https://apps.who.int/classifications/apps/icd/ClassificationDownload/DLArea/Download.aspx

description.left: Indicate the tumour staging system used to stage the cancer at the time of the diagnosis, prior to treatment
description.right: Indicate the tumour staging system used to stage the cancer at the time of primary diagnosis (prior to treatment).

description.left: Stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting clinical_tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.)
description.right: Stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting clinical_tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.).

description.left: The code to represent the extent of the primary tumour (T) based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual
description.right: The code to represent the extent of the primary tumour (T) based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

description.left: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual
description.right: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

description.left: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual
description.right: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual. MX is NOT a valid category and cannot be assigned.

meta.notes: For WHO ICD-10 codes, refer to https://apps.who.int/classifications/apps/icd/ClassificationDownload/DLArea/Download.aspx

diagnosis_source_text.name: diagnosis_source_text
diagnosis_source_text.description: Condition as reported in the study's dataset

meta.notes: Provide exact information as per the dataset if coding to ICD-10 or MONDO ontologies is not possible

diagnosis_mondo_term.name: diagnosis_mondo_term
diagnosis_mondo_term.description: Mondo code and term used to define a condtion

meta.examples: MONDO_0002131: jaw cancer, MONDO_0001056: gastric cancer
meta.notes: Write code and full term used in MONDO separated by a (:). For MONDO codes, refer to https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/mondo

is_cancer_primary.name: is_cancer_primary
is_cancer_primary.description: Diagnosis is a primary cancer diagnosis

meta.notes: This field is only required to be submitted if the donor's diagnosis is cancer

notes.left: Refer to the WHO ATC https://www.whocc.no/atc_ddd_index/ to classify the active ingredients of drug according to the organ or system on which it acts and its therapeutic, pharmacological and chemical properties. Drugs should be coded at the 5th level of the ATC.
notes.right: The DIN uniquely identifies the manufacturer, product name, active ingredient(s), strength(s) of active ingredient(s);pharmaceutical form and route of administration.
